com.gwtplatform.mvp.client

Class PopupViewImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewImpl
      • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.PopupViewImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsWidget, PopupView, View
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PopupViewWithUiHandlers

    public abstract class PopupViewImpl
extends ViewImpl
implements PopupView
    A simple implementation of PopupView that can be used when the widget returned by ViewImpl.asWidget() inherits from PopupPanel.

    Also, this implementation simply disregards every call to ViewImpl.setInSlot(Object, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget), ViewImpl.addToSlot(Object, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget), and ViewImpl.removeFromSlot(Object, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected PopupViewImpl(EventBus eventBus)
      The PopupViewImpl class uses the EventBus to listen to NavigationEvent in order to automatically close when this event is fired, if desired.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected PopupPanel asPopupPanel()
      Retrieves this view as a PopupPanel.
      void center()
      Make sure the PopupView is centered in the browser's client area.
      protected void doCenter()
      This method centers the popup panel, temporarily making it visible if needed.
      void hide()
      Make sure the PopupView is hidden.
      void setAutoHideOnNavigationEventEnabled(boolean autoHide)
      Indicates that the view should automatically hide when a GWTP NavigationEvent is fired.
      void setCloseHandler(PopupViewCloseHandler popupViewCloseHandler)
      Identifies which PopupViewCloseHandler should be called when this view closed (either automatically or through a call to PopupView.hide().
      void setPosition(int left, int top)
      Reposition the PopupView within the browser's client area.
      void show()
      Important! Do not call this directly, instead use PresenterWidget.addToPopupSlot(PresenterWidget) passing this view's PresenterWidget.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PopupViewImpl

        protected PopupViewImpl(EventBus eventBus)
        The PopupViewImpl class uses the EventBus to listen to NavigationEvent in order to automatically close when this event is fired, if desired. See setAutoHideOnNavigationEventEnabled(boolean) for details.
        Parameters:
        eventBus - The EventBus.

    • Method Detail

      • center

        public void center()
        Description copied from interface: PopupView
        Make sure the PopupView is centered in the browser's client area. This method should not change the view visibility: if it was hidden (resp. visible) it remains hidden (resp. visible).
        Specified by:
        center in interface PopupView

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Description copied from interface: PopupView
        Make sure the PopupView is hidden. You can call this method directly.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface PopupView

      • setAutoHideOnNavigationEventEnabled

        public void setAutoHideOnNavigationEventEnabled(boolean autoHide)
        Description copied from interface: PopupView
        Indicates that the view should automatically hide when a GWTP NavigationEvent is fired. This is better than using GWT's PopupPanel.setAutoHideOnHistoryEventsEnabled(boolean) since the latter will automatically hide the dialog even if navigation is refused through PlaceManager.setOnLeaveConfirmation(String) .
        Specified by:
        setAutoHideOnNavigationEventEnabled in interface PopupView

      • setCloseHandler

        public void setCloseHandler(PopupViewCloseHandler popupViewCloseHandler)
        Description copied from interface: PopupView
        Identifies which PopupViewCloseHandler should be called when this view closed (either automatically or through a call to PopupView.hide().
        Specified by:
        setCloseHandler in interface PopupView
        Parameters:
        popupViewCloseHandler - The PopupViewCloseHandler or null to unregister any handlers.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int left,
               int top)
        Description copied from interface: PopupView
        Reposition the PopupView within the browser's client area. This method should not change the view visibility: if it was hidden (resp. visible) it remains hidden (resp. visible).
        Specified by:
        setPosition in interface PopupView
        Parameters:
        left - The left position of the top-left corner (in pixels).
        top - The top position of the top-left corner (in pixels).

      • show

        public void show()
        Description copied from interface: PopupView
        Important! Do not call this directly, instead use PresenterWidget.addToPopupSlot(PresenterWidget) passing this view's PresenterWidget.

        Make sure the PopupView is visible.

        Specified by:
        show in interface PopupView

        protected PopupPanel asPopupPanel()
        Retrieves this view as a PopupPanel. See ViewImpl.asWidget().

      • doCenter
